subknowledge.content: Basics of neural networks, including their architecture and how they mimic the human brain.
Understanding different activation functions, focusing on ReLU, and its purpose to introduce non-linearity.
Explaining how loss functions measure model performance and guide weight adjustments.
Backpropagation in the context of CNNs and its importance for learning from errors.
The theory and application of pooling layers in CNNs to reduce feature dimensionality.
How convolutional layers extract features from data, focusing on image recognition and object detection.
Covering the aim of increasing data diversity to prevent overfitting and improve model generalization.
Detailed examples of image transformations and their impact on model training.

subknowledge.knowledge: Beyond Images: Augmentation for Text and Audio
subknowledge.content: Exploring augmentation techniques for other types of data such as text and audio.
A deep dive into gradient descent and its variants, focusing on why it's fundamental for training neural networks.
Exploring how different optimizers like Adam and RMSProp work, and when to use them.
Introducing concepts like Dropout and Batch Normalization to combat overfitting.
Explaining Dropout's mechanics, its impact during training vs. testing, and how it prevents overfitting.
Guidelines for implementing Dropout in models and adjusting dropout rates based on the context.
Choosing a real-world problem and planning a project to apply deep learning concepts learned.
Using the knowledge acquired to build, train, and evaluate a neural network model on a dataset.
Presenting the project results and receiving feedback to understand areas of strength and improvement.
